name: William Shakespeare: A Biography
description: A glove-maker's son who invented the modern human — 37 plays, 154 sonnets, and four centuries of arguments about who he really was

name: Frida Kahlo: A Biography
description: Shattered spine, shattered marriage, unflinching self-portraits — the woman who turned agony into art and became the most recognized female artist in history

name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart: A Biography
description: Child prodigy, freelance genius, pauper's grave — 600 compositions in 35 years and the question of what he might have written if he had lived

name: Toni Morrison: A Biography
description: The novelist who refused to explain Black life to white readers — and won the Nobel Prize for writing the stories America had never told

name: Pablo Picasso: A Biography
description: The man who broke art and rebuilt it — Cubism, Guernica, 50,000 works, and a personal life that the feminist era has not forgiven

name: Charlie Chaplin: A Biography
description: Born in a workhouse, became the most famous face on Earth, exiled by the country that made him — the Tramp who laughed at power

name: Bob Marley: A Biography
description: From Trenchtown to the world — the only Third World artist to achieve global superstardom, shot and still performing, dead at 36 and immortal

name: Maya Angelou: A Biography
description: Silenced by trauma at seven, speaking for the nation at Clinton's inauguration — the caged bird who sang until the whole country listened
